titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Wilbur Fisk Tillett Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

bioghist.head: A Chronology

chronitem.event: in Hendersonville, North Carolina, to John Tillett and Elizabeth Jenkins Wyche Tillett.
Enrolled at Trinity College, now Duke University
Transferred to Randolph-Macon
Instructor in English and Mathematics at Randolph-Macon
Entered Princeton Theological Seminary
Master of Arts from Princeton
Received into Virginia Conference of Methodist Episcopal Church, South and appointed pastor of Lynn Street Church, Danville, Virginia
Began teaching career at Vanderbilt through influence of Bishop Holland N. McTyeire. First Chaplain of the university as well as teacher of Systematic Theology.
Adjunct professor of Systematic Theology
Full professor of Systematic Theology 1886-1919 Dean of the Biblical Dept. and Vice-chancellor
Married Kate Schoolfield, who died in 1889.
Member of committee compiling the Hymn Book of the Methodist Episcopal Church, South
Married Laura Elizabeth McCloud
Member of Board of Education of Tennessee Conference of M.E. Church, South
Published Personal Salvation: Studies in Christian Doctrine Pertaining to the Spiritual Life - one of his most widely read books
Member of Commission preparing the Methodist Hymnal
Member of General Board of Education of M.E. Church, South
Member of the Executive Committee of Federal Council of the Churches of Christ in America
Dean Emeritus of Vanderbilt Biblical Department
Died

bioghist.p: Source: Lester H. Colloms. Wilbur Fisk Tillett. Louisville The Cloister Press, 1949.
Doctor of Sacred Theology - Northwestern University.
Doctor of Sacred Theology - Wesleyan University.
Mistress of Arts and Science - Ashville Female College
Certificate of Proficiency - Ward Seminary for Young Ladies.
Special Certificate - Ward Seminary for Young Ladies.

did.unittitle: Correspondence - Outgoing - Consisting of 24 letters, mostly carbon copies. Arranged chronologically. Two letters are undated and are placed at the end.

note.p: Consisting of 24 letters, mostly carbon copies. Arranged chronologically. Two letters are undated and are placed at the end.
Total of 84 letters. Three postcards. Majority in typescript.

did.unittitle: Printed New Year Greeting Cards signed by Dr. Tillett
Personal notes on various subjects - holograph
Notes relating to hymn studies and book on annotated hymns. MSS of chapters
Ms Material for Published Work on Hymns
Ms Material for Published Work on Hymns
Poems. 13 pieces. Arranged alphabetically by title
Songs - Two songs for which Dr. Tillett wrote the words. “My Father Knows” - 2 copies; “O Vanderbilt: Dear Vanderbilt!” - 3 copies
Publication by Dr. Tillett - 25 pamphlets; 1 book
Reviews of Dr. Tillett’s Books. “A Book That Will Live”; “Hymns and Hymn Writers of the Church”; “A Statement of the Faith of World-Wide Methodism - 2 copies
Publications and Articles by Other Authors. 7 pamphlets; 2 typescript articles. Arranged alphabetically by title
Miscellaneous. 14 items. Including Vanderbilt Commencement program, 2 pamphlets, one photograph, announcements, one typed anecdote, one copy of partial charter of Emory University, etc.
Newspaper and Magazine Clippings - Alphabetically arranged according to subject
Small Scrapbook of Dr. Tillett. Large Scrapbook placed separately with Ms boxes
Volume of Letters of Appreciation on Occasion of Dr. Tillett’s Retirement
Galliard’s Hymn of Adam and Eve, out of Fifth Book of Milton’s Paradise Lost (1728)
Nine Diplomas and Certificates placed separately in red tubed container next to Ms boxes
Fitzhugh, G. T. and Biggs, Albert W

did.unitdate: April 26, 1935; March 25, 1935; Jan. 6, 1936; Feb. 4, 1936 - enclosure. Feb 24, 1936; June 18, 1936 - enclosure
June 15, 1909 to Maj. F. P. McWhirter

physdesc.extent: (also editorial included on p. 37 of paper)

The Rights and Duties of the Methodist Episcopal Church, South in Vanderbilt University
The South’s Greatest Teacher of Boys

Biographical Index of the Authors of the Hymns - no author given

unittitle.emph: The Praise of the Virgin in Early Latin Hymns
The Significance of the Old French Psalter

note.p: Last three pamphlets and Hymn Festival Programs are part of a series edited by Carl F. Price, The Papers of the Hymn Society.
